item.description:
THE BEST OF BOTH WORLDS!

What do you get when cell phone meets computer ? An iPhone.

What do you get when electricity meets a car? An electric car with a smooth ride.

What do you get when a story slam meets a writer's workshop? Magic!

Storytellers, story lovers, story listeners and writers at all levels are invited to partake in the launch of this new and innovative event which is a a collaboration between Jay O'Callahan's writers group "Spoken Voices" and South Shore Conservatory.

“Spoken Voices” and South Shore Conservatory present the very first Writer’s Block Slam Shop on November 16th, 7 pm at South Shore Conservatory, 1 Conservatory Dr. Hingham.  Award winning storyteller Jay O'Callahan leads the workshop portion of the evening andAndrea Lovett, co -founder of massmouth story slams, leads the slam element of the night.

Audience members will be invited to write from a prompt given by O'Callahan.

Writers will have eight minutes from start to finish to write their pieces as a South Shore

Conservatory student plays music for the audience's added enjoyment and inspiration. When the time is up writers are invited to drop their names in the hat for a chance to read their stories. Eight lucky writers will read their freshly written pieces. A panel of writers from Spoken Voices will give feedback to readers after they have finished.  The audience has a chance to choose their favorites and prizes will be awarded.

The second evening in this series is on November 30th at South Shore Conservatory 64 St. George St. Duxbury. Tickets are $15.00 online @ www.sscmusic.org or at the door.

For more information, please contact Andrea Lovett at 781.267.9979 For more information onSpoken Voices please visit:http://spokenvoices-storyspace.blogspot.com/ Learn more about South Shore Conservatory at www.sscmusic.org.

group.name: Greater Boston and MA Storytelling Meetup Group

item.name: Writer's Block Slam Shop-Where Story Slam Meets Writer's Workshop!
